main_definition: To postpone or delay an action, decision, or event to a later time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to put off or delay an event, task, or obligation until a future date or moment
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to defer the product launch due to unforeseen technical issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To postpone paying an owed amount of money or debt for a later date
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to defer her loan repayment due to financial difficulties during the pandemic.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An agreement between two parties where one party agrees not to enforce their legal right in regards to something until a specified time has passed
meanings_and_examples.example: They signed a deferred payment plan for his education, allowing him to pay later without penalty.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To prioritize less important tasks or issues over more urgent ones
meanings_and_examples.example: Due to limited resources, the team had to defer their attention from minor bugs to critical system failures first.
